greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways the perfect power A001597(n) can be written as a^b, with a, b > 1.
comment: Run lengths of A072103. Also, the terms a(n) which exceed 1 constitute A175066. - _Andrey Zabolotskiy_, Aug 17 2016
example: a(1)=0 since A001597(1)=1 can be written as a^b for a=1 and any b, but not using a base a > 1.
a(2)=a(3)=a(4)=1 since the following terms 4=2^2, 8=2^3 and 9=3^2 can be written as perfect powers in only one way.
results.author: _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 25 2015
